definition: to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: They towed the van to the church parking lot for safekeeping.
sentences.chinese: 他们把箱型车拖到教会的停车场保管。

sentences.english: A: There’s a sign that says NO PARKING.
sentences.chinese: 那里有块“禁止停车”的标志牌。

sentences.english: I parked in the lot at Central High.
sentences.chinese: 我把车停在了中央高中的停车场。

sentences.english: It offers 2 cosy rooms with a private balcony, a flat-screen TV and free Wi-Fi.
sentences.chinese: 酒店还为客人提供免费停车卡和免费无线网络连接。

sentences.english: Many cars lay jostling each other at the parking lot.
sentences.chinese: 许多汽车在停车场上紧紧挨在一起。

sentences.english: Only use the handbrake when your vehicle is stationary.
sentences.chinese: 只有在停车时才动用手刹。

sentences.english: I am sorry that I have to drop you here. This is no parking zone.
sentences.chinese: 这里不能长时间停车，我只能把你送到这了。

sentences.english: Cascarellian considered this for a moment. Then he called the convoy to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 老卡斯卡利安想了一会，然后喝令护卫队停车。

sentences.english: This brake can't be banked on if we have to pull up suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们必须紧急停车，这个刹车是不可靠的。

sentences.english: NO01, Double-parking is illegal, and it blocks traffic.
sentences.chinese: 并排停车是违法的，而且也会造成交通堵塞。

sentences.english: Express trains don't stop at Princeton junction.
sentences.chinese: 特快列车不在普林斯顿枢纽站停车。

sentences.english: The C.O.s tell them that they can’t park there.
sentences.chinese: 狱警告诉他们，这里不许停车。

sentences.english: One car made a sudden stop and the car behind it pilled up.
sentences.chinese: 由于前面的车急停车，紧随其后的车撞了上去。

sentences.english: More cars would not only bring traffic congestion, but also noise and parking problems.
sentences.chinese: 车辆增加不仅会造成塞车，也会制造噪音和停车问题。
可接纳50人左右团队，自备停车场。

definition: parking spot/unloading point/garage place/stand for taxi
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
to park (a car etc)/to moor (a boat etc)/to leave sth (in a place)
